revised_title: Investigating the Metamorphosis of Saccharine Matter in the Animal Economy
tldr: The author examines the transformation of sugar in the animal body, focusing on the role of molecular changes in the nitrogenized constituents and the influence of oxygen. The study suggests that the physiological destruction of sugar is similar to fermentation, with lactic acid being present in the system and molecular changes in the nitrogenized compounds playing a significant role in the process.
